page.title: 11EASTERN WELLS
page.content: Eastern Wells is a residential suburb of Wells. The Bath Road which is a l9th century mail coach route from London to Exeter runs through the suburb and along it are a number of l9th century houses. Housing developed along it in a continuous line between the wars, with typical semi_detached houses and bungalows. After the war a small council estate called Churchill Road was built on the northern side and later, during the fifties and sixties, the King Castle and Woodbury Avenue estates were built for private residential use on the southern side. Further building in this area is a problem because the houses lie in a valley and building higher up the slopes would be intrusive and is prohibited by planning restrictions. Consequently, more recent growth of Wells has largely occurred in the West
